page.title: 15Guides At Shuttlewood
page.content: I go to guides every Wednesday at 7.30pm till 9.00pm. Our{uniform consists of a navy blue skirt, a navy blouse, a red neckchief and a plaited leather waddle. We can wear any shoes we like. In each pack we have different groups called{Patrols.} The Patrols have names, our patrols are called Scarlet pimpernel, Bluebell, White heather and Primrose. Our troup are celebrating{75 years}of Guiding at a place called Marheaton Park in Derbyshire. We will dress in old Guide costumes and will have a games store and later on a camp fire. This will be lit by a flame brought from Princess Margaret. In July 1985 we went to{Peak '85 at Chatsworth. There was dry Skiing, Canoeing, Hang Gliding and lots more. By SARAH TOWNSEND.
